subject: RE: [junit] setUp versus constructors
msgSnippet: ... I found that sentence interesting.  I don t think you have to be a JUnit guru to know what setUp() and tearDown() do.  That s one of the first things
messageBody:
> The semantics of using a
> constructor also seem far more obvious to me as everyone
> reading my code knows Java, while not everyone is a JUnit guru.

I found that sentence interesting. I don't think
you have to be a JUnit guru to know what setUp()
and tearDown() do. That's one of the first things
anyone learns when they do anything with JUnit.
And it seems weird that someone would know Java,
be interested in reviewing your unit tests, and
NOT know JUnit.


Todd.
